okay  so  one day uh I decided to go outside and enjoy the nice weather and go for a jog
uh I noticed that I had been  that I was feeling kinda weak and feeling kinda nauseous
um thinking that it was just uh part of getting back into exercise I didn't think too much of it
however the following days it continued to get worse and worse
um I started to get more nauseous and feel more weak
and I was sleeping up to twenty one hours a day
um finally I decided that I needed to go to the doctor
and at that point I had become jaundice which is yellow  s yellow skin and the whites of my eyes had become yellow
uh the doctor had sent me to the hospital and  where I was hospitalized for four days while they did tests to figure what might be wrong with me
uh all of my family came to visit
and they hadta wear gloves for protection since they didn't know what was wrong with me
and after several tests and several visits from the doctor they discovered that it was Hepatitis_a
and after several days of being on i_v and getting rehydrated uh I did recover as there is no cure
and I  after about  about two months after that after I got out_of the hospital
I was one hundred percent recovered and very happy that it wasn't something worse
the end

okay  so  a few years ago when I was in school uh I was taking a class where I was partnered up with uh a student from China who had a very difficult  who had difficulties communicating verbally in English
um he  he was hard to understand

but I did my best to communicate with him by um maybe not trying to understand his complete sentences but trying to pick out words out_of what he was saying and try to match that into the context of what was going on around us to piece together what he might be saying

and also I helped the communication by trying to repeat what he was saying or continue the conversation on uh stating how I was understanding him so_that at some point if I didn't understand him he would realize that I wasn't understanding him
and afrel after several weeks it just got easier and easier to understand what he was saying
I would  just became accustomed to the accent and the words that he might choose to use
and over time it got easier
